data.job_description:
If we inspire you to do the work you love, will you still call it work?

What's in it for you?

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our EY Data and Analytics team ideally in our Melbourne and Sydney offices but can also be based in any of the major Australian cities. Working with a number of high profile clients this role is offered on a flexible, full-time basis.

You will help shape, change, and deliver a data management roadmap to improve and enhance the value and re-usability of data, through modern and evolving data management practices and frameworks.

As a Data Analyst, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives, you will work with a diverse range of stakeholders and data teams to uplift the current data quality management capabilities of a number of different high profile client groups.

What We're Looking For

Translating business questions to data and analysis requirements; carry out analysis, visualization and presentation.

Performing ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions.

Design and build data products, such as Power BI dashboards, including defining the data models.

Surfacing and sharing insights, typically from internal corporate data, using a dashboard.

Run human centred design sessions with end-users.

Communicating and influencing stakeholders.

Coaching non-data experts how to use data.

Skills And Attributes For Success

Experience in a hands-on role interpreting and telling stories with data.

Curious and business outcome focused with an ability to break down a complex problem and work out how to solve it.

Evidence of numerical and technical aptitude strong collaboration skills having worked with business stakeholders at different levels of seniority.

Comfortable working across a wide range of data sets and systems.

Expertise in cleansing, combining and processing data.

Have knowledge of SQL, with knowledge of Python an advantage.

Familiarity with Power BI and ideally data manipulation tools (e.g. Alteryx and Daraiku).

The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000 including 11% superannuation.

Data Analyst

Are you a Data Analyst who is keen to bridge your technical skills with a passion for Sport? Are you interested in developing your technical skills whilst enabling the next generation of Western Australian Olympians and Paralympians to achieve their goals?

About WAIS

The Western Australian Institute of Sport (WAIS) is the peak high-performance sporting organisation in Western Australia. WAIS has a proud history of Olympic, Paralympic and World Champions who have accomplished amazing achievements within sport and in life. WAIS enables and supports WA athletes to achieve success on a national and international level. Our culture of Striving for Excellence is lived through the behaviours of athletes and staff that demonstrate Passion, Integrity, Quality and Teamwork.

WAIS is proudly supported by the State Government and is a member of the National Institute Network who collectively support National and State Sporting Organisations to deliver the National High Performance Sport Strategy.

About the role

The Data Analyst supports the delivery of the sports intelligence strategy with skills in scripting, querying and analytics to deliver timely and accurate insight to stakeholders.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Performance Systems and Analytics (PSA) team which is a newly formed team in the Western Australian Institute of Sport (WAIS). WAIS supports Western Australian athletes perform at the highest levels through providing coaching, training environment and support services (including medical, sports science, coaches, and other service providers. The role of data analyst is key to support the Performance Systems and Analytics team deliver the WAIS sports intelligence strategy.

This position entails a multifaceted scope, affording you the opportunity to acquire and cultivate skills through practical experience. Core duties will include the following:

· Organisation Intelligence: Build and maintain reports, dashboards and intelligence solutions for stakeholders

· Data management: Maintain current and future processes and standards on the data platform

· Data ingestion: Build and maintain sustainable ingestion solutions for new external data sources

· Organisational Data Literacy: Assist in creating organisational data literacy, culture and trust in data solutions

· Communication with stakeholders

The role is based out of the WAIS High Performance Service Centre in the Mt Claremont Sporting Precinct and may require domestic travel.

About you

We are looking for an enthusiastic Data Analyst with proven technical abilities to support the work of the Performance Systems and Analytics Team.

Experience and qualification requirements:

· Experience with SQL, Python and dashboarding tools (Power BI, Tableau etc.)

· Database management

· Ability to translate stakeholder requirements then design and implement relevant solutions

· Data visualisation, reporting and communication

· Familiarity with sports analytics frameworks

· Ability to work with a multidisciplinary team

· Passion for sport and sports performance

Desirable:

· Experience with Fusion/Smartabase

· Experience with Azure

· Data engineering experience

· Power BI experience

Next steps

To apply, you must create an account via our career’s portal and apply https://wais.elmotalent.com.au/careers/default/jobs

Please submit a one-page cover letter along with your resume and experience against the Position Description found on our careers portal.

Applications will close on 4th September 2023, at 5pm AWST.

Please note, shortlisting of candidates will commence prior to this date and applicants are encouraged to apply at your earliest opportunity.

This is a full-time, maximum term contract. The anticipated salary is from $80,570 - $86,797 + superannuation and will be negotiated with the successful candidate.

Please note, only successful applicants will be contacted for an interview.

For further information

For role related queries please contact Kawther Sidhoum, HR Advisor, via email ksidhoum@wais.org.au

Building System Capability

At WAIS, we offer career opportunities for people who share our ambition and passion for high performance sport. From graduates to expert professionals, we are committed to offering fulfilling careers and the chance to grow as we grow. We would love you to be part of our journey.

Apply today.

About the role:

The Tertiary Skills and Pathways team is responsible for the unit mapping project, as part of its program of work. Unit mapping uses natural language processing techniques to create a connection between tertiary education learning materials (VET and HE units), and skills taxonomies. Unit mapping helps to identify skills taught in tertiary education, and their potential relationship to occupations and the labour market, to assist in analysis and advice on tertiary education delivery.

The team is working on a demonstration project basis with five key projects to design the end to end process of unit mapping, to continually refine the data science model, and to generate insights on the potential use of mapping outputs. The outputs of models are large, for example one university with approximately 3,000 units can have an output of approximately 30,000 skills mapped. Validation of outputs is a critical part of the mapping process to produce a model and results that are highly accurate.

Duties:
• Developing of a comprehensive internal and external validation process for very large data sets, to support improvement of data science models, and the quality of output data sent to partners. This may require an ensemble of approaches, for example statistical sampling, manual and automated approaches to validation.
• Managing internal validation processes before outputs are sent to project partners.
• Working closely with the data science team to provide feedback for the mapping model development.
• Analysing complex model outputs, to derive valuable insights for reporting to project partners, including visualisation techniques.
• Providing advice to technical services on interface design for a validation application for project partners.

Required experience/skills:
• Demonstrated experience in data analysis and process design, to create replicable data validation processes to improve data output quality.
• Excellent analytical skills, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to synthesise and critically analyse large volumes of structured and unstructured data.
• Strong skills and experience in data management, in particular how data can be effectively structured, analysed, presented and communicated, to achieve high-quality outcomes.
• Excellent communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate key data insights visually and in written form to a range of diverse stakeholders
• Well-developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary setting.

Desirable experience skills:
• Experience in R Shiny, Python, SQL, anduser experience design.
• Understanding of, and experience working with tertiary education (HE and/or VET) and/or occupation and labour market data.
• Understanding and experience in data science, or related fields.
• Experience operating in a policy environment.

The Data Analyst is an integral role within the SPS Division specializing in the analysis of contractual obligations, KPIs and monthly reporting.

Our Company

Pacific Energy is one of Australia’s leading producers of sustainable distributed energy. We’ve been servicing remote townships, utilities and the mining industry for more than 40 years, delivering customised systems that integrate solar, wind, gas, diesel and battery storage systems.

Our dedicated team of experts and complete in-house capabilities mean we can deliver world-class projects from beginning to end, safely and on time.

We’re proud to be Australia’s largest remote power station builder and operator, with 48 sites nationally and more than 40% of our energy portfolio now powered by renewable and hybrid systems.

At Pacific Energy, we know the importance of a clean energy future. That’s why our organisation is driven by some of the industry’s finest engineers, electrical contractors, production specialists and project managers. Join us and help pave the way to a cleaner, brighter future.

Our Role

Our office in Perth is currently looking for a Data Analyst to work within the Service, Products and Stand-alone Power Systems Division, specializing in the analysis of contractual obligations, key performance indicators (KPIs), and monthly reporting on operational Renewable Energy assets and power stations.

This role will work closely with the Contract Manager and other internal stakeholders to provide actionable insights derived from financial, CRM, CMMS, and ERP systems data.

The Data Analyst will utilize tools such as Power BI, Power Query, and Excel to Export, Transform & Load (ETL) data into meaningful models and reports that drive business decisions for clients, managers, and teams.

Key Responsibilities

Position’s Duties Include But Are Not Limited To
• Contractual Analysis: Review and analyse contractual obligations and KPIs defined by the Contract Manager related to operational Renewable Energy assets and power stations.
• Monthly Reporting: Generate monthly reports focusing on the performance and status of energy systems designed, constructed, and/or owned by the Group.
• Data Integration: Assist in the analysis, reporting, and forecasting of data from financial, CRM, CMMS, and ERP systems.
• ETL Processes: Collaborate with internal subject matter experts to Export, Transform & Load data into useful data models and reports.
• Data Visualization: Utilize Power BI and Power Query to create compelling visualizations that communicate complex data in a straightforward manner.
• Stakeholder Communication: Present findings and insights to the Contract Manager, clients, and internal teams to inform and drive business decisions.
• Quality Assurance: Ensure the accuracy and consistency of data by implementing and following best practices in data management.
• Continuous Learning: Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements in data analytics tools and techniques.
• Responsible for compliance with OHS policies, ensuring workplace compliance, and reporting hazards and near misses.
• Foster a workforce culture of excellence, innovation, honesty and teamwork.
Selection Criteria:
• Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Business, or related field.
• 1-2 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the Renewable Energy sector.
• Proficiency in Power BI, Power Query, and MS Excel.
• Additional skills in Python, SQL, VBA, R, or similar languages would be advantageous.
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
• Excellent interpersonal and communications skills
• Excellent communication and time management skills, conflict resolution abilities and confidence dealing with a wide range of people, from tradespeople to customers/stakeholders and supervisors.
• Understanding of OHSE requirements.
Additional benefits include:
• 9 Day fortnight (optional)
• Salary continuance insurance
• Employee Assistance Program (EAP), accessible to all employees and their families
• Retention bonus scheme
• Additional paid days off exceeding annual leave
• Employee referral program
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Pacific Energy, we celebrate the richness and depth that diversity brings. We know that it’s good for our people, our customers and the solutions that we bring to the table. That’s why we strongly encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, cultures, abilities, sexual orientations and gender identities to apply. We’re always learning, so please let us know what adjustments we can make to our recruiting processes to better support you.

For more information visit www.pacificenergy.com.au/ or follow Pacific Energy on LinkedIn at www.linkedin.com/company/pacific-energy-pty-ltd

About Our Client

Our client is a data consulting firm with offices in Australia, London and the USA, who work with a range of clients across utilities, resources, government and finance-sector clients.

You will be embedded with one of their utilities clients, working in parallel to a couple of other consultants in there (but also quite independently), as a key contributor to their data and analytics function.

You'll be supported with on-the-job training and have access to salary increases against your performance, as well as opportunity to move through formal training and certifications, in support of your success.

Job Description

You will be responsible for:
• Analysing business processes, collecting business requirements, assisting with specification of solutions.
• Sourcing, restructuring, manipulating, and modelling data to support decisions around clients' commercial issues.
• Supporting client understanding of analytical insight through creative presentation of data visualisations.
• Documenting implemented solutions and processes, providing guides and trainings for users.
• Ensuring all data management and processing is undertaken in adherence with internal policies.
• Building relationships within the business, working towards common objectives.

The Successful Applicant

To be considered for and successful in this role you will:
• Arrive with 2+ year's experience in a similar role, and be ready to expand your level of responsibility and autonomy
• Be able to demonstrate your commercial acumen, in delivering insights (not just analysis), to drive decision making within an organisation
• Ideally offer some programming experience in R or Python
• Be competent to build meaningful dashboards and reports that meet business requirements
• Offer good foundational skills in Excel, SQL, Power BI (including DAX)

What's on Offer

In return you will:
• Align with a data specific consulting firm, who will support your success in this role, and your ongoing development within the organisation more broadly
• Develop your skills in basic data engineering
• Pick up some experience in cloud technologies including Snowflake
• Get to access formal professional development opportunities
• Work in an autonomous role with a reasonable degree of responsibility / the ability to make your own decisions

Hybrid working combining Perth office-based and work from home

Supportive and inclusive workplace fostering strong collaboration

Newly created role with significant business exposure

Want a better job?

You’ll find it at Alinta Energy.

We’re making energy better for our more than 1.1 million customers – and we’re making work life better for our 1,000+ people too.

We believe in better

At Alinta Energy, we’re a friendly bunch working to be the best energy company. Our culture is collaborative, and our passion drives positive change for people and the planet.

Over the past decade, we’ve evolved from a Western Australian residential gas retailer to one of Australia’s largest energy retailers, generators, investors, and developers with infrastructure across Australia and New Zealand.

Help us make energy better

About the role:

Alinta Energy are looking for a collaborative Data Analyst to join their Trading & Portfolio Management team based in Perth. Specifically, you will be providing support to our customers as well as our business by transforming raw data into meaningful insights that contribute to future data and system enhancements.

In this permanent full-time role, you will work closely with cross-functional teams in providing assurance over financial data and ensuring alignment across systems and processes, through establishing frameworks, control reporting and regular risk-based testing and analysis.

In this role, you’ll be:

Supporting in the overall of scoping, planning, delivery of financial assurance

Developing and executing control reporting, dashboards and other methodologies to easily assess the accuracy of systems and processes

The Company

Seequent builds world-leading subsurface software, helping create a better understanding of the earth to ensure a better world for all.

Job description:

We support Western Power’s objectives through fit-for-purpose data so the business can extract maximum value from our assets in any work location. We need your support to ensure appropriate techniques and tools are used to deliver solutions to the business that they can use to generate insights that yield better & faster decisions, using data they can trust and understand. Keep reading if you’d like to learn more!

As a Data Analyst at Western Power you will:

The purpose of this position is to provide technical business and data intelligence support and coordination of everyday data operations and governance activities. This role supports both the Data Operations and Analytics Area level data projects and activities, as well as, the day to day activities of the team. The team builds, operates, maintains and provides functional support for data solutions used by the business and externals. Work aligns to our enterprise data management and governance frameworks and is supported by a large area of data engineers, data scientists, solutions architects geospatial specialists and information architects to name a few.

This position also provides targeted technical analysis to support area and business decision making and expertise to support investigations into new technologies and innovative data management and governance solutions.

We are seeking someone with experience and attributes that include:
• Degree in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) or Business-related discipline or an equivalent combination of relevant significant experience and/or education/training.
• Demonstrated knowledge, understanding and application of information change management principles
• Proven commitment to continuous improvement of data, systems and processes
• Proven capability to analyse data and formulate solutions using Business Intelligence tools (Qlik (preferable)or other Industry standard tool), Geospatial Information Systems (desirable), and Database skills and tools
• Highly developed time management and multitasking skills, with a proven commitment to ongoing professional development
• Strong written and verbal communication skills, particularly for customer contact
• Strong coordination and project management skills are preferable
• Process and business analysis skills would be advantageous.

We believe that Tech & Data is the best place to be in Western Power because it’s not often that you get the chance to establish a whole new capability within a large organisation in WA. Everyone in the team is passionate about making it work and making it work well; we’re a hands-on, conscientious bunch, and always look for opportunities to improve. Tech & Data Services is the ‘engine room’ but we’re not just stoking the boilers, we’re developing the machine.

At Western Power, we strive to deliver exceptional value through:
• Valuing empathy and psychological safety for everyone.
• Building trust through transparency, mastery and reliability, prioritising continuous improvement.
• Leading honest and respectful conversations.
• Developing a strong understanding of our business and how it operates.
• Employee Network Groups – First Nations, Culturally and Linguistically Diverse, Diverse Sexualities and Genders, Women, and People with Disability – which celebrate and communicate the diversity of our workforce and connect diversity and inclusion to our broader business activities.
• Flexible work arrangements that support part time work, flexible working hours and working from home arrangements.
• Professional Development opportunities including training initiatives and study assistance.

Who We Are

Akkodis, we thrive on solving complex problems and building a smarter future; we power digital transformation and accelerate innovation with our cross-industry technology and digital engineering consulting, talent services and skilling. We're passionate about our work and committed to creating

and implementing cutting-edge solutions that drive industry progress. Our culture is built on honesty, respect, fairness and inclusion, and we're looking for innovative and talented individuals who share these values to join us on this journey.

The Role

Participating in projects being managed as incremental, iterative and adaptive (Agile) or predictive plan driven the Akkodis consulting Business Analyst role focuses on ensuring client value is delivered for assignments. This Business Analyst is leveraging past business analysis experiences to recognise and support stakeholder change journey required. This Business Analyst role is seeking to develop within an organisation providing consultancy services and build their breadth and/or specialisms within industry domains, types of delivery assignments, or techniques and methods used.

Responsibilities
• Undertake business analysis as part of a project delivery team or individual consulting assignment across range of industry and clients.
• Investigate business situations where there is some complexity and ambiguity.
• Adopt holistic view to identify and analyse problems and opportunities.
• Engage and collaborate with stakeholders.
• Conduct analysis and identifies recommendations for improvements.
• Follow agreed standards, applying appropriate techniques to elicit and document requirements to appropriate level.
• Demonstrate good stakeholder management skills and provides constructive challenge to stakeholders as required.
• Demonstrate business analysis competencies and Agile mindset.
• Help develop and enhance customer and stakeholder relationships.

Skills & Experience

Required
• Between 3 - 5 years' experience undertaking Business Analyst roles delivering outcomes.
• Has awareness of project management delivery styles and where/how it applies to business analysis delivery.
• Ability to select appropriate requirements and engagement technique/s based on the nature of the assignment.
• Experience in defining and managing scope, requirements definition and prioritisation activities for small-scale changes and assists with more complex change initiatives.
• Ability to model current and desired scenarios to facilitate understanding and decision making.
• Ability to analyse and design business processes to identify alternative solutions to exploit new technologies and automation.
• Experience creating acceptance criteria related to requirements, features and user stories.
• Experience in applying standard data modelling and design techniques, based upon a detailed understanding of requirements.
• Sound documentation and communication skills.

Desirable
• Experience in participating in managing change activities.
• Ability to translate concepts into outputs and prototypes and captures user feedback to improve designs.
• Capability in dealing with problems and issues, managing resolutions, corrective actions, lessons learned and the collection and dissemination of relevant information.
• Participation in study groups and/or courses to gain understanding of BABOK®, Agile, Design Thinking, Business Data Analytics and Product Ownership Analysis

data.job_title: EOI - Data Engineer - Data and Analytics
data.job_description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

What if your most rewarding experiences couldn’t be captured by a resume?

At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.

We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world. This role is open to applicants across Adelaide, Melbourne, Perth, Brisbane, Canberra and Sydney.

EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.
• As this is an expressions of interest advertisement, please allow some delay in us getting back to your application*

What’s in it for you?

As a Data Engineer, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives. Some of your responsibilities will include:
• Be able to clearly explain data and analytics strengths and weaknesses to both technical and senior business stakeholders
• Responsible for developing batch ingestion and data transformation routines using ETL tools or other ingestion techniques
• Responsible for developing real-time ingestion and data transformation routines using Kafka and similar technologies
• Responsible for migrating data from legacy data platform to cloud data platform
• Present data in graphs, charts, tables, etc. and designing and developing relational databases for collecting data.

What We’re Looking For

Here’s our ‘wish list’ but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes. We’re interested in your strengths, what you want to learn, and how far you want to go.
• Configuration and coordination of data pipelines across projects
• Data pipeline development, including Azure Data Factory, AWS Kinesis and/or Spark
• Migration and transformation of large complex data sets from legacy systems like Teradata to cloud platform using Azure tools and other ETL tools like DataStage
• Data and Reporting Platform development on environments using technologies such as Microsoft Azure, SAP BW, Teradata, PowerBI or Cognos
• A strong background in coding with possible experience with Python, SAS, SQL and/or R
• Project delivery toolset experience in one or more batch ETL tools (such as DataStage, Informatica, Microsoft SSIS, Azure Data Factory or Talend) and/or open-source data integration tools (such as Kafka or Nifi)

What We Can Offer You
• Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at www.ey.com/au/careerdevelopment
• Discover how, when and where you can work at www.ey.com/au/flexibility
• Learn about our commitment to DE&I at www.ey.com/au/diversity-inclusiveness
• Understand how our benefits can support you at www.ey.com/au/benefits

Acknowledgement of Country

EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders — past, present, and emerging. Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at www.ey.com/au/reconciliation

Apply now… we’re over 9,000 perspectives in Australia and we’re ready to welcome yours.

At EY we take inclusivity seriously, and we’re committed to removing barriers and improving the employment prospects of people with disability or long-term health conditions. We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process. We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2). Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.

The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.

Our preferred applicant will be required to undertake employment screening by EY or our external third-party provider.

The minimum salary for this role is AUD $90,000 inclusive of 11% superannuation and dependent on skills and experience.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

data.job_description:
Our Data Support Analysts maintain the data models and organise data help to lead the adoption of modern data platforms and ways of working.

We're looking for hands-on data support analysts to join our managed services team. You will be responsible for building data models to organise important data for different teams across the business and for monitoring and handling data.

This is an exciting opportunity to bring your current skill sets in data and enhance your career by working on some of the most exciting data managed services opportunities in the UK.

In addition to gathering, analysing and cleansing information, you will be asked to create business reports for teams and individuals across the business, and help translate analytics into non-technical insights to help all teams make well-informed decisions based on empirical evidence.

We encourage continuous learning, so as well as the opportunity to work with some of the brightest and best in the industry, we have learning paths to consulting available for those looking to advance their careers.

You'll work with our Managed Service teams alongside service analysts, service delivery managers, developers, architects, designers, analysts and product owners to support and resolve incidents and to drive innovation and automation, tooling and data infrastructure development.

You will have an opportunity to join our data academies as well to further your career and learn more about cloud technology.

Responsibilities include:
• Work with our service delivery teams to help support data services
• Work with a variety of data sources - extracting knowledge and actionable information from massive datasets
• Build and flesh out data models in our database for use in regular and/or automated reporting and analysis
• Convey your work and results to a wide variety of internal and external stakeholders
• Evaluate operations for inefficiencies and identify areas where you can create, automate, and develop tools (SQL-based or otherwise)
• Support the business with ad hoc reporting
• Enhance data quality and reliability
• Prioritise and manage several open issues at one time
• Follow up with clients to ensure their IT systems are fully functional after troubleshooting
• Prepare accurate and timely reports
• Document technical knowledge in the form of notes and manuals
• Maintain strong relationships with clients

About You

You will be familiar with using various methods to transform raw data into useful data systems. To succeed in this data support position, you should have strong analytical skills and the ability to combine data from different sources. If you are detail-oriented, with excellent organisational skills and experience in this field, we'd like to hear from you.

A degree in a relevant field like Maths, Computer Science, IT or Software Engineering is advantageous or the equivalent level of experience. An understanding of Microsoft, AWS or GCP technologies and Python.

If you are naturally a helper, enjoy assisting people with data related issues and are able to explain technical details simply, we'd like to meet you.

The role will have flexible working hours on a shift system and will possibly include occasional late-night shifts or out of hours working.

Ultimately, you will be a person our customer's trust. They will rely on you to provide timely and accurate solutions to their technical problems.

Requirements for the role
• Be a passionate problem solver - breaking down problems and developing analytical insights
• Experience in supporting business operations in an analytics capacity
• A love for insights, innate curiosity, and a deep desire to find ways to create value
• Solid communication skills
• Passion for automation
• Comfort in a complex data environment and understanding of data structures
• Experience with SQL and Excel (Experience with Python or R is a plus, )
• Experience with some flavour of data visualisation
• Experience using PowerBI Dev
• Good presentation skils
• Data Visualisation skills
• Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics experience is nice to have
• Splunk Search nice to have

Some of the Perks
• Flexible benefits allowance – you choose how to spend your allowance (additional pension contributions, healthcare, dental and more)
• Industry leading health and wellbeing plan - we partner with several wellbeing support functions to cater to each individual's need, including 24/7 GP services, mental health support, and other
• Life Assurance (4 x annual salary)
• 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
• Hybrid working - Our roles are not fully remote as we take pride in the tight knit communities we have created at our local offices. But we offer plenty of flexibility and you can split your time between the office, client site and WFH
• Discounts – we have preferred rates from dozens of retail, lifestyle, and utility brands
• An industry-leading referral scheme with no limits on the number of referrals
• Flexible holiday buy/sell option
• Electric vehicle scheme
• Training opportunities and incentives – we support professional certifications across engineering and non-engineering roles, including unlimited access to O'Reilly
• Giving back – the ability to get involved nationally and regionally with partnerships to get people from diverse backgrounds into tech
• You will become part of a squad with people from different areas within the business who will help you grow at BJSS
• We have a busy social calendar that you can choose to join– quarterly town halls/squad nights out/weekends away with families included/office get togethers
• GymFlex gym membership programme

Please note: any applicants must be able to gain valid SC clearance.

LOCATION: Remote Work

SCHEDULE: Part-time

Are you an aspiring data analyst seeking an unparalleled opportunity to gain hands-on experience while working with a prestigious Management Consulting firm? TalentKompass Deutschland, a leading Human Resources company based in Germany, is searching for a highly motivated Data Analysis Intern to join our esteemed client. This remote position offers a unique chance for someone who is passionate about data analysis and eager to learn in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

As a Data Analysis Intern, you will work closely with the analytics and consulting teams, where you will be responsible for a range of tasks, including data collection, data cleaning, and statistical analysis. You will have the extraordinary opportunity to learn from experienced professionals who will provide mentorship and guidance throughout the internship. With this internship, you will gain valuable experience in data analysis, data visualization, and teamwork – all essential skills for a successful career in this field.

Responsibilities:
• Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to support consulting projects
• Assist in the development of data models and statistical analysis to identify trends and insights
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze data
• Create data visualizations and dashboards using tools such as Tableau or Power BI
• Present findings and insights to the consulting team and contribute to project reports
• Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute ideas for data-driven solutions
• Support the team with general administrative tasks as needed

Requirements:
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Proficient in Microsoft Excel or other data analysis tools
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
• Familiarity with data analysis principles and practices
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team
• Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
• Knowledge of statistical analysis tools and techniques is a plus
• Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI is a plus

At TalentKompass Deutschland, we are committed to helping our interns develop their skills and reach their full potential. Our client is a reputable Management Consulting firm that will provide invaluable experience in a competitive industry. Don't miss this fantastic opportunity to grow your career in data analysis – apply now!

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this Role, you’ll get to:
• Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests
• Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others
• Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers

What you’ll Need to Succeed:
• Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
• Ability to communicate fluently in English
• Good numerical reasoning skills
• Proficiency in Excel
• Intellectual curiosity

It’s Great if you Have:
• Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL
• Experience in digital marketing

data.job_description:
Job Summary

As the appointee, you will contribute to research, course management, teaching and service in the area of business analytics within the Centre, Department of Management & Organisations and the wider Business School. The successful applicant will have teaching experience within a higher education environment, specifically within business analytics. A PhD degree or equivalent is essential. We are particularly interested in candidates whose teaching and research interests are summarized by one or several of the following keywords: statistical and machine learning algorithms, artificial intelligence, deep learning, big data, rule-based/hybrid ensembles, predictive and prescriptive modelling, optimization, linear/nonlinear programming, network programming, integer programming, stochastic optimization, web analytics, web scraping, social media analytics, data and process mining, social network analytics, text mining, visual analytics, information and telecommunication technologies, mobile technologies, management information systems, geographical information systems, information modelling, vehicular traffic flow simulation, autonomous vehicles and connected vehicles, vehicle dynamics and control, robotics and unmanned aerial vehicles related to smart cities.

The position is responsible to the Head of Department. You will be expected to make a contribution to research, teaching and service within the Department, Centre for Business Data Analytics, School and University in line with the expectations of Business School academic staff.
Key responsibilities
• Demonstrate a commitment to, and achievement in, high quality research as evidenced by publications in world-leading journals and the attraction of research funding;
• Demonstrate a commitment to high quality teaching and learning;
• Demonstrate a willingness to be involved in professional and administrative activities in the Centre, Department, School and University.

Your specific work capabilities (selection criteria)

For Lecturer (Level B):
Qualifications PhD or near completion in business analytics or a related field

Research and Scholarship
• Demonstrate a strong capacity to undertake research and publish in high quality international peerreviewed journals;
• Demonstrate an ability to attract significant research funding through grants and industry collaborations; and
• Show evidence of a willingness to direct and supervise honours and postgraduate research students.

Teaching and Learning
Demonstrate a personal contribution and commitment to high quality teaching.

Service
Within the University: Applicants should demonstrate a willingness to be involved in service and administration in the Centre, Department, School and University.

Outside the University: Where appropriate, applicants should show a willingness to liaise with members of the community, professional and relevant industry bodies.

General
Willingness to work collaboratively with other members of the School. The successful candidate must be willing to work within the legislative requirements of the University and support the University’s commitment to equity.

For Senior Lecturer (Level C):

Qualifications
PhD in business analytics or a related field

Research and Scholarship
• Demonstrate a strong research track record displaying an ability to undertake research and publish in high quality international peer-reviewed journals;
• Demonstrate an ability to attract significant research funding through grants and industry collaborations; and
• Show evidence of a willingness to direct and supervise honours and postgraduate research students.

Teaching and Learning
Provide evidence of commitment to high quality teaching, including the development of curriculum and initiatives in effective learning.

Service
Within the University: Applicants should demonstrate a willingness to be involved in service and administration in the Centre, Department, School and University.

Outside the University: Where appropriate, applicants should show a willingness to liaise with members of the community, professional and relevant industry bodies.

General
Willingness to work collaboratively with other members of the School. The successful candidate must be willing to work within the legislative requirements of the University and support the University’s commitment to equity.

Full Job Description
Location:
Perth Office - CBD, WA, AU

6 Sep 2023

We currently have a wonderful opportunity for a Data Analyst at our Perth Head Office, on a 12-month contract basis.

This is a unique and exciting time to be a part of the Tech & Data Services team at Western Power. We are at the forefront of the energy transition in leveraging existing and new technologies, including microgrid, stand-alone power systems (SPS), battery storage solutions and incorporating increased levels of renewable energy such as roof top solar into the energy system. We're transforming the electricity network ensuring a cleaner, brighter and more resilient energy supply for the next generation.

We're also working hard on enabling the decarbonisation of the energy system by converting more of our energy consumption to electricity, including electric vehicles (EVs) as well as other initiatives to enable industry sectors to reduce emissions by making the switch.

The transition to the energy system of the future is reliant on innovation in the Tech & Data Services space. Longer term, we’ll be focusing on the establishment of foundational services, provided in an efficient, reliable and highly accessible manner. We will apply a lifecycle management approach to these services, so we are accountable for the strategy, implementation and ongoing operation of our products.

We support Western Power’s objectives through fit-for-purpose data so the business can extract maximum value from our assets in any work location. We need your support to ensure appropriate techniques and tools are used to deliver solutions to the business that they can use to generate insights that yield better & faster decisions, using data they can trust and understand. Keep reading if you’d like to learn more!

As a Data Analyst at Western Power you will:
The purpose of this position is to provide technical business and data intelligence support and coordination of everyday data operations and governance activities. This role supports both the Data Operations and Analytics Area level data projects and activities, as well as, the day to day activities of the team. The team builds, operates, maintains and provides functional support for data solutions used by the business and externals. Work aligns to our enterprise data management and governance frameworks and is supported by a large area of data engineers, data scientists, solutions architects geospatial specialists and information architects to name a few.

This position also provides targeted technical analysis to support area and business decision making and expertise to support investigations into new technologies and innovative data management and governance solutions.

We are seeking someone with experience and attributes that include:

Degree in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) or Business-related discipline or an equivalent combination of relevant significant experience and/or education/training.
Demonstrated knowledge, understanding and application of information change management principles
Proven commitment to continuous improvement of data, systems and processes
Proven capability to analyse data and formulate solutions using Business Intelligence tools (Qlik (preferable)or other Industry standard tool), Geospatial Information Systems (desirable), and Database skills and tools
Highly developed time management and multitasking skills, with a proven commitment to ongoing professional development
Strong written and verbal communication skills, particularly for customer contact
Strong coordination and project management skills are preferable
Process and business analysis skills would be advantageous.

We believe that Tech & Data is the best place to be in Western Power because it’s not often that you get the chance to establish a whole new capability within a large organisation in WA. Everyone in the team is passionate about making it work and making it work well; we’re a hands-on, conscientious bunch, and always look for opportunities to improve. Tech & Data Services is the ‘engine room’ but we’re not just stoking the boilers, we’re developing the machine.

At Western Power, we strive to deliver exceptional value through:

Valuing empathy and psychological safety for everyone.
Building trust through transparency, mastery and reliability, prioritising continuous improvement.
Leading honest and respectful conversations.
Developing a strong understanding of our business and how it operates.
Employee Network Groups - First Nations, Culturally and Linguistically Diverse, Diverse Sexualities and Genders, Women, and People with Disability - which celebrate and communicate the diversity of our workforce and connect diversity and inclusion to our broader business activities.
Flexible work arrangements that support part time work, flexible working hours and working from home arrangements.
Professional Development opportunities including training initiatives and study assistance.

Important information

We are committed to our Disability Access and Inclusion Plan 2021 - 2027 and ensuring that people with disability have equal opportunities to gain and maintain employment with Western Power. It is strongly encouraged that people with a disability who meet the inherent requirements of the position description apply for this role.

We are also proud to have launched our Innovate RAP in Mar 2022 (Reconciliation Action Plan). Our Innovate RAP outlines our commitment to the Reconciliation journey in WA.

Our recruitment process requires that all candidates who progress to the pre-employment stage must hold a police clearance issued within the last six months.

Join us and play a part in powering the future of Western Australia and click apply!

Unlock the power of data as our Senior Geoscience Data Analyst. Join a dynamic team driving innovation, stakeholder engagement, and modernisation within our department's systems.

About the role

As Senior Geoscience Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role within our dynamic team, responsible for a wide spectrum of data management, design, analysis, and reporting tasks. You will lead efforts to apply data analysis and visualisation techniques, contributing to enhanced business efficiency and decision-making, both internally within the department and externally with stakeholders. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to collaborate on various data and digital initiatives, playing a pivotal role in the modernisation of departmental systems.

Your expertise in data management, analytics, integration, and exchange will be instrumental in your success in this role. Extensive experience in data analytics, proficiency with data visualisation tools, and expertise in application/methodology/scripting languages such as Python and SQL scripting are essential qualifications for this position.

About us

The Department supports a safe, fair and responsible future for the Western Australian community, industry, energy and resources sector. We lead with integrity, deliver on commitments, strive for excellence, and look for better ways of doing things.

Underlying everything we do are our values of being respectful, responsive, forward-thinking, transparent, fair, and ethical – these are driven by our staff who make us a success.

To learn more about the Department and what we have to offer, please visit our website, and to keep up to date on activities, you can follow us on LinkedIn.

Where will you work?

This position is located in East Perth, accessible by public transport and reasonably priced City of Perth parking options nearby. Whether it’s enjoying the tranquil Queens Gardens or the riverside foreshore, you’ll be spoilt for choice. You will also enjoy onsite lifestyle facilities, including bike lockers, fully equipped change rooms and personal lockers. The Department gym is conveniently located across the road at 1 Adelaide Terrace. We offer an affordable gym membership, providing you with an opportunity to prioritise your health and well-being.

Need further information?

To learn more about the role, please refer to the Job Description Form (JDF) attached. If you have any questions about the role itself to help tailor your application, please contact Chee Ng, Manager Geoscience Data Architect on (08) 9222 0414.

How to apply

To apply for this position, click ‘Apply for Job’ at the bottom of this page to and complete the online application form.

In your application, please provide:

A detailed resume outlining your work history, education and professional development and covering letter of no more than two (2) pages, addressing the following points:
• A Degree in Data or Computing Science or extensive experience in the relevant field.
• Solid understanding and experience in data management, analytics, integration and exchange.
• Extensive experience in data analytics, data visualisation tools and integrations application/methodology/scripting language such as python and SQL scripting.

We encourage you to carefully consider these points and tailor your covering letter to address them effectively. This will provide us with a comprehensive understanding of your qualifications, skills, and suitability for the position.

We have also attached an Applicant Information Pack for your reference. If you have any questions about employment conditions or the application process, please contact Jacqueline Gao, Human Resource Officer on (08) 9222 3632 or email RecruitmentandEngagement@dmirs.wa.gov.au.

All requirements, capabilities and pre-employment checks listed on the attached JDF will be assessed as part of the selection process.

Other benefits

We offer a range of benefits to our employees, creating a supportive, diverse, and innovative work environment, including:
• Great work/life balance with 37.5 hour working week as a standard and flexible working hours for most roles.
• Leave options including purchase leave, deferred leave and long service leave after 7 years.
• Flexibility to work at home, in the field and in the office for most roles.
• Stable work, job security, fair remuneration, 11% superannuation contributions to a provider of your choice and salary packaging options.
• The ability to give back to your community and make a difference.
• A collaborative environment with the ability to gain insight from subject matter experts in your field.
• Opportunities for professional development, acting, shadowing and mentoring.
• Support to grow your skills with a wide range of formal training options.
• Build a healthy lifestyle with our award-winning Health and Wellbeing program.
• Supportive work environment including an Employee Assistance Program to assist you deal with life’s challenges.

Supporting a diverse workforce

The department is committed to creating and maintaining a diverse workforce that reflects the community we serve and inclusive culture where all employees feel valued, respected and connected. Our workforce's diversity is our strength; it enhances our ability to be forward-thinking and responsive in the services we deliver to the Western Australian community. Learn more about our Diversity and Inclusion Awards, celebrating individuals and teams who have demonstrated exceptional dedication to fostering an inclusive workplace culture.

Suitable Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disability and youth may be given priority consideration over non diversity group applicants to achieve public sector outcomes. Reasonable adjustments will be provided to candidates with disabilities during our recruitment processes and in the workplace.

While this selection process will initially be used to fill the above vacancy, it may also be used to fill other "similar" vacancies (permanent, fixed-term, full-time or part-time) within the department for the next twelve (12) months.

CLOSING DATE: 4.00 pm on Tuesday, 3 October 2023 (WST)

Want a better job?

You’ll find it at Alinta Energy.

We’re making energy better for our more than 1.1 million customers - and we’re making work life better for our 1,000+ people too.

We believe in better
At Alinta Energy, we’re a friendly bunch working to be the best energy company. Our culture is collaborative, and our passion drives positive change for people and the planet.

Over the past decade, we’ve evolved from a Western Australian residential gas retailer to one of Australia’s largest energy retailers, generators, investors, and developers with infrastructure across Australia and New Zealand.

Help us make energy better

About the role:
Alinta Energy are looking for a collaborative Data Analyst to join their Trading & Portfolio Management team based in Perth. Specifically, you will be providing support to our customers as well as our business by transforming raw data into meaningful insights that contribute to future data and system enhancements.

In this permanent full-time role, you will work closely with cross-functional teams in providing assurance over financial data and ensuring alignment across systems and processes, through establishing frameworks, control reporting and regular risk-based testing and analysis.

In this role, you’ll be:
Supporting in the overall of scoping, planning, delivery of financial assurance
Developing and executing control reporting, dashboards and other methodologies to easily assess the accuracy of systems and processes
Proactively contribute to the continuous improvement of the function, highlighting opportunities to enhance ways of working, processes, and automation
Developing a strong understanding of the operational systems, their interdependencies and operational use to ensure accuracy and compliance for the business and our customers
Demonstrating daily personal behaviour that uphold Alinta Energy values.

Ideally, you’ll bring to the role:
A relevant tertiary qualification in Commerce, Data Science, Computer Science, or other relevant numeric discipline
Experience in a data, assurance, or commercial role
Working knowledge of SQL is essential and the ability to learn programming languages such as Python and R.
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A strong sense of collaboration and a passion for problem solving.

This is a fabulous role with great exposure to the business so understanding the importance of establishing strong business relationships will be paramount to your success.

Enjoy better benefits - check out our careers page for more information!

One the best things about Alinta Energy is we discover better together. If you like the sound of that, and you’re a match for the role, we’d love to talk to you.

Alinta Energy. That’s better.

Perenti is an ASX listed diversified mining services group with interests in contract mining, mining support services and future technology solutions. Headquartered in Perth, Australia, and operating across four continents with a workforce of more than 9,000 employees, our focus is to create enduring value and certainty for our investors, clients, employees and the communities in which we operate.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Engineer to join our team on a 6 month, contract basis. As a Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining our data infrastructure, ensuring that data is readily available and accessible to support our organization's analytical and reporting needs. If you are passionate about data, have expertise in SQL, Polybase, SSRS, Azure, and experience with Infosphere, we would like to hear from you.

Key responsibilities of the role will include:
• Data Pipeline Development: Design, build, and maintain data pipelines to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources into our data warehouse.
• SQL Expertise: Write complex SQL queries and optimize database performance to support data extraction and reporting needs.
• Polybase Integration: Utilize Polybase to connect and query data from heterogeneous sources, ensuring data integration and compatibility.
• SSRS Reporting: Develop and maintain SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) reports to deliver actionable insights to stakeholders.

• Data Quality Assurance: Implement data quality checks and validation processes to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data.
• Performance Optimization: Monitor and optimize the performance of data pipelines and databases to ensure efficient data processing.
• Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for data engineering processes, data models, and configurations.
• Collaboration: Work closely with data analysts, data scientists, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver data solutions that meet business needs.

Experience & Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
• Proven experience as a Data Engineer or similar role, with a strong foundation in SQL.
• Proficiency in Polybase and experience with SSRS for reporting.
• Strong expertise in Azure services, including Azure Data Factory and Azure SQL Data Warehouse.
• Familiarity with IBM Infosphere or similar data integration tools is a plus.
• Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL processes.
• Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
• Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
• Self-motivated with a strong desire to learn and adapt to new technologies.

Our Employee Benefits program acknowledges our employees with extensive offers from corporate partners including novated leasing, health insurance discounts, travel/accommodation benefits, and flexible working opportunities.

We strive to create an inclusive environment for all employees and value diversity.

Manager Geoscience Data Integration

About the role

As Manager Geoscience Data Integration, you will play a vital role in leading a diverse team of geoscientists and data scientists.

Your responsibilities will encompass the conception and development of innovative data layers and datasets. These resources will be instrumental in enhancing our comprehension of the mineral and energy potential within the State, as well as in offering advice for land use planning matters.

Your overarching duties will encompass the guidance of both the scientific and strategic facets of the project, all while ensuring that task milestones are achieved within budgetary constraints and adhering to the prescribed timeline.

We are currently seeking candidates who possess a strategic mindset and boast an extensive background in geoscience data modelling, integration, analysis, and design.

Your proficiency in utilising data science scripting languages such as Python, R, and Matlab, coupled with your adeptness in reporting via data visualisation tools, including GIS, will undoubtedly contribute to your success in this role.

About us

Within the Resource and Environmental Regulation Group, the Geological Survey and Resource Strategy Division is responsible for strategic resource policy setting and the facilitation of investment through the provision of geoscience data and products.

The division manages the Exploration Incentive Scheme including the co-funded drilling and geophysics programs. The division also provides information and products to support the approval of mining tenements and petroleum titles and other related legislative compliance processes.

To learn more about the Department and what we have to offer, please visit our website, and to keep up to date on activities, you can follow us on LinkedIn.

Where will you work?

This position is located in East Perth, accessible by public transport and reasonably priced City of Perth parking options nearby.

Need further information?

To learn more about the role, please refer to the Job Description Form (JDF) attached. If you have any questions about the role itself to help tailor your application, please contact Simon Johnson, Director Regional Geoscience on (08) 9222 3127.

Other benefits

We offer a range of benefits to our employees, creating a supportive, diverse, and innovative work environment, including :
• Great work / life balance with 37.5 hour working week as a standard and flexible working hours for most roles.
• Leave options including purchase leave, deferred leave and long service leave after 7 years.

• Build a healthy lifestyle with our award-winning Health and Wellbeing program.
• Supportive work environment including an Employee Assistance Program to assist you deal with life’s challenges.

How to apply

To apply for this position, click here’ and you will be redirected to Jobs WA to complete the online application form. In your application, please provide :

A detailed resume outlining your work history, education and professional development and covering letter of no more than two (2) pages, addressing the following points :
• Bachelor of Science (Geoscience) or an approved equivalent Degree.

• Experience in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning techniques.

We encourage you to carefully consider these points and tailor your covering letter to address them effectively. This will provide us with a comprehensive understanding of your qualifications, skills, and suitability for the position.

If you have any questions about employment conditions or the application process, please contact Jacqueline Gao, Human Resource Officer on (08) 9222 3632 or email RecruitmentandEngagement@dmirs.wa.gov.au.

CLOSING DATE : 4.00 pm on Monday, 9 October 2023 (WST)

Working at Access Analytic

Access Analytic is a world-famous consulting and training company that specialises in providing amazing Power BI, Excel and complimentary solutions in areas such as financial modelling, reporting, dashboards, data analytics and training for medium and large companies.

We have a client base that is the envy of our competitors covering most of Perth’s top companies.

Highly Desirable

Professional Accounting / Management Reporting background

Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst Exam PL-300

Advanced Excel skills

Power Apps and Power Automate experience

A working knowledge of Azure SQL Databases

About The Role

Salary range is between $120,000 and $150,000/year + superannuation

Duties & Responsibilities

In this role you will work across all areas of the business, interact with a range of stakeholders, and use your knowledge of analytics to add value.

On a Day-today Bases This Will Include

DHL Global Forwarding (Australia) Pty Ltd is a global leader in the Freight Forwarding industry. We currently have a vacancy for a Senior Project Operations Specialist in our Industrial Projects Team based in our Perth office, WA.

About Us

Connecting People. Improving Lives.

DHL is the leading global brand in the logistics industry. Our DHL divisions offer an unrivalled portfolio of logistics services ranging from national and international parcel delivery, e-commerce shipping and fulfillment solutions, international express, road, air, and ocean transport to industrial supply chain management. With about 380,000 employees in more than 220 countries and territories worldwide, DHL connects people and businesses securely and reliably, enabling global sustainable trade flows. With specialized solutions for growth markets and industries including technology, life sciences and healthcare, engineering, manufacturing & energy, auto-mobility, and retail, DHL is decisively positioned as “The logistics company for the world”.

DHL is part of Deutsche Post DHL Group. The Group generated revenues of more than 81 billion euros in 2021. With sustainable business practices and a commitment to society and the environment, the Group makes a positive contribution to the world. Deutsche Post DHL Group aims to achieve net-zero emissions logistics by 2050.

Overall Role Purpose
• Provide customised freight forwarding solutions to meet or exceed customer requirements.
• Manage and support the execution of complex project shipments maintaining safety throughout.
• Maintenance and update of freight movement records on the Tracking System and with shipment record files.
• Liaise with carriers, sub-contractors and project clients in the coordination of freight movements.
• Strictly control the record keeping of cargo deliveries to the client at relevant handover points.
• Positively contribute in promoting safe and best practices with regards to HSE compliance within DGF Group, its Clients, Subcontractors and affiliates.
• Minimise risk exposure through careful planning of work activities, adherence to all internal and external procedures, and identification and reporting of hazards.
• Help the Project meet strict KPI deadlines without compromising safety standards.
• Work very closely with Project Manager and other key project team members to ensure project priorities are completed in a timely manner.
• Supervise all cargo handling requirements for the project. May be implanted in client’s depots and/or project site pending project requirement.
• Ensure cargo handling procedures are compliant with internal HSE processes, Operational procedures and industry best practice.
• Preparation of quotations for freight movements.
• Support and participate in Project Implementations in line company and client requirements.
• Support and participate in Project Tenders and RFQ’s
• Project invoicing and File Profitability Management – including financial reporting and invoice preparation and submission in line with company and client requirements.

Skills / Qualifications
• Tertiary qualified or an equivalent qualification
• At least (5) five years working experience in Project Operations, Logistics, Logistics Systems, or industry-related fields.
• Minimum three (3) to five (5) years of previous experience/knowledge of International Project Operations / Freight Forwarding / Account Management
• COR Certifications
• Wide ranging knowledge of Industrial Projects and/or the freight forwarding business, its

characteristics, competitors and likely future evolution.
• Experience handling Heavy Lift and Over Dimensional cargoes.
• Experience supervising sub-contractors.
• Strong Knowledge of Road Transport and Freight Forwarding procedures and regulations.
• Strong knowledge of cargo handling procedures and requirements.
• Strong knowledge of project over-dimensional and heavy lift cargo handling procedures.
• Strong operational management, risk management and business process skills.
• Strong HSE disciplines and adherence to DHL and Client compliance requirements.
• Strong problem-solving abilities.
• Strong consulting, persuasion, influencing and negotiation skills.
• The ability to make safe and responsible decisions yet meet project KPI’s and project deadlines.
• Organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and deliver time pressure and limited information/resources
• Sound administrative skills
• Results-driven and attention to details
• Able to work independently and coordinate account management requirements i.e. client visits
• A high degree of reliability and attention to detail
• Be a team player with a positive can-do attitude
• Be results driven and be able to demonstrate strong communication and administration skills
• Possess a high degree of attention to detail and a professional work ethic.

Why DHL Global Forwarding?

In a global business like ours, the opportunities are endless. So join us. Work with us. Grow with us. Stay with us. Discover the positive impact you can make and build an amazing DHL career.

We're one big team:
Our culture, our values, and the way we work together as a team, ensure that everyone feels valued and rewarded for the contribution they bring.

We grow together:
We've worked hard to create an environment where every individual can keep learning, keep growing, and enjoy a rewarding long-term career.

We do the right thing:
We understand the importance of contributing to society, reducing our environmental impact, and making a positive difference in the world.

Excellence. Simply Delivered.

Interested? … We would love to hear from you right away. APPLY NOW!

The role
